thread.title_full: 60-year-old woman arrested after string of armed robberies in Cedar Hill, Duncanville | Crime | Dallas News

author: dallasnews
title: 60-year-old woman arrested after string of armed robberies in Cedar Hill, Duncanville | Crime
text:
A 60-year-old Dallas woman has been arrested after a string of robberies in Cedar Hill and Duncanville.
Katie Lee Jones (Cedar Hill Police Department) Katie Lee Jones, 60, was taken into custody Wednesday, Cedar Hill police said.
Around 12:30 p.m. Sunday, officers were called to the MetroPCS store in the 600 block of Uptown Boulevard, near FM1382 in Cedar Hill, about a robbery in progress. The robber, a woman wielding a gun, stole money and merchandise and fled before officers arrived.
On Wednesday, officers were called about a robbery at the Chase Bank in the 200 block of North U.S. Highway 67, near Town Square Boulevard in Cedar Hill. The robber in that case showed a teller a gun and fled after stealing money.
That afternoon, Cedar Hill officers served an arrest warrant at a Dallas apartment belonging to Jones, who had been identified as a suspect in the MetroPCS robbery.
Police said they found evidence at the apartment that connected her to the Chase Bank robbery as well as a robbery Saturday at a Duncanville bank.
Jones is being held at the Tri-City Jail on two counts of aggravated robbery related to the Cedar Hill crimes, as well as one robbery count out of Duncanville. Her bail is set at $225,000.
